capricorn

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • capricorn.Utilities

  • public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains utilities that are used in multiple classes. Most functions are universal in use.

      Utilities()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Utilities

        public Utilities()

    • Method Detail

      • checkWindows

        public static boolean checkWindows()
        Returns:
        true if the operating system is Windows, false if it is not. Due to the compatability of Capricorn, false assumes it is run on Linux. Mac OS X is not supported.

      • getDirectories

        public static java.util.List<java.nio.file.Path> getDirectories(boolean createFolders)
        This is the public function which returns all the honeypot folder locations. IMPORTANT NOTE: if a folder doesn't exist, it is created
        Parameters:
        createFolders - specify if missing honeypot folders should be created if they're not present
        Returns:
        the locations of the honeypot folders

      • getRootDrive

        public static java.nio.file.Path getRootDrive()
        Get the root of the drive on which the user folders are located.
        Returns:
        the path to the root of the drive

      • getRandomListEntry

        public static java.lang.String getRandomListEntry(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
        Using the given list, a random entry out of the list will be returned
        Parameters:
        list - the list out of which the random entry must be chosen
        Returns:
        a random entry out of the given list

      • checkDirectory

        public static boolean checkDirectory(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Check if a directory exists
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the directory
        Returns:
        true if the file exists and is a directory, false if otherwise

      • checkFile

        public static boolean checkFile(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Check if a file exists
        Parameters:
        path - path to the file
        Returns:
        true if the file exists and is a file, false if otherwise

      • writeFile

        public static boolean writeFile(java.util.List<java.lang.String> fileContent,
                                java.lang.String pwd,
                                java.lang.String outputName)
        Parameters:
        fileContent - the content which should be written to the file
        pwd - The directory in which the file should be placed. pwd is short for 'print working directory' (similar to the bash command).
        outputName - the name of the file which is written in pwd
        Returns:
        true if the writing is successful, false if there is an error.

      • emptyHoneypots

        public static void emptyHoneypots()
        Empty the honeypot folders

      • removeHoneypotFolders

        public static void removeHoneypotFolders()
        Remove the honeypot folders

      • getFileSeparator

        public static java.lang.String getFileSeparator()
        Get the system specific file separator
        Returns:
        the system specific file separator
